reviews.text: It is reasonably priced compared to the other restaurants we went to. Would I return? Not sure, probably because it is convenient to the hotel and it's a fun atmosphere but I of all the meals we had in Barbados this had the most average food.

We were staying at the Fermont Royal Pavilion almost next door and we walked along the beach to the resturant. The menu was very good and the staff were excelent. We sat looking out over the waves lapping on to the golden sands and watched the flames of the torches flickering in a light breeze. It is paradise. The food was very tasty, well presented a first class experiance. Its not cheap but well worth the £50 per head inc drinks. However this was cheaper than a rubish BBQ in the Fermont go you will not be disapointed.
reviews.title: Poor service, poorly cooked, overpriced.

reviews.text: We visited over the Christmas/New Year break and had booked in advance because we knew it was going to be busy. A friend had suggested we go there for Sunday lunch because it was excellent - and my word it was just that!! We'd arrived early so were seated at the bar for a drink beforehand (the place was still packed even though we were having a late lunch). It had a lovely buzzy busy atmosphere and because its all open around the sides was lovely and cool.
reviews.title: Sunday Lunch at the Lone Star

reviews.text: We had Ceaser Salad starters, Roast Beef dinner and the apple crumble for dessert. We picked a lovely bottle of wine and finished it all off with coffee. We were seated sea front and it really was a delightfully relaxing afternoon. (I know its cheesey to go on holiday and have a British roast dinner but all the guests in there - the Canadians, Americans, German etc - were all having it and it looked delicious).
reviews.title: glad that we weren't the only ones ...
FABULOUS ATMOSPHERE, FABULOUS FOOD ....
reviews.text: I have to say this was probably one of the best meals we had during our three week stay (and we went everywhere including Sandy Lane, Champers, Tapas etc etc). Its not cheap but then none of the most popular restaurants in the Lone Star range are. Every course was to die for! Excellently cooked and delicious. We found the staff to be excellent - our waiter was brilliant at explaining the specials and the menu and not in any way condescending and the waitress who took our order was delightful. The service was second to none and to top it all off the sunset was just amazing. I didn't feel in any way out of place and had a thoroughly lovely afternoon that I'd very much like to repeat one day!
